meanings.definition: To work out or express by studious effort
meanings.sent1: She spent hours elucubrating on her essay for school.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys elucubrating his thoughts through writing.
meanings.sent3: The detective was elucubrating the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was elucubrating a plan to ace the exam.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was elucubrating a theory to explain the phenomenon.

meanings.sent1: The author was elucubrating a new novel in her mind.
meanings.sent2: The artist was elucubrating a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The chef was elucubrating a unique recipe for the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: His imagination was elucubrating a world of fantasy.
meanings.sent5: The inventor was elucubrating a groundbreaking invention.

meanings.definition: To work out carefully and thoroughly
meanings.sent1: She was elucubrating the details of her plan before presenting it.
meanings.sent2: The architect was elucubrating the blueprints for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was elucubrating the layout of the flower beds.
meanings.sent4: The team was elucubrating a strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The student was elucubrating the steps of the scientific experiment.
